column4: Ok, I need serious help. Under the gnome menu, all my applications have disappeared, my whole configuration of gnome is wiped out.
Is there anyway to roll back to a previous state?
create a fresh new user and see if the problem persists
Will try. I can't even reach the logout, etc in System.
use tty1
you. ;)
right, so now we know it's just a configuration issue.  Try renaming ~/.local/share/applications/ and ~/.config/menus/ as a start
Will do. I noticed I don't have ~/.gnome2 , gconf or gconfd left in my original users folder.
weird
I know. Then it hardly seems worth the time. :(
Thanks for the help anyway, will see what I can do.
any idea what caused the files to disappear?
Uh. Now I do, it seems I ran out of hdd space.
ah
Is that a common factor? And also, is there any way to get them back?
I haven't seen a full hard drive cause the deletion of files before, no.  I don't know how you would get them back
I pinged out, did you say something?
I haven't seen a full hard drive cause the deletion of files before, no.  I don't know how you would get them back
Then I will just reformat, it was long overdue. Thanks for your help!
seems like overkill!
I know I can fix it, but I have all sorts of problem with my setup, it was my first ubuntu install so there's a lot of screw-ups.
ah
